title: 1968 Chevrolet Corvette

description: This 1968 Convertible Corvette is powered by a 427 cubic inch V8 engine and is paired to a 4-speed manual transmission. Options on this '68 Corvette for sale include: AM/FM Radio, Manual Convertible Top, Power Brakes, Leather Interior and Michelin radial tires wrapped around Chevy Rallye wheels. This is an original 427 cubic inch Corvette and the classic retains its original engine and transmission, stated by its owner to be numbers matching. With only 98,618 original miles on this iconic British Green over Tobacco big block vette, it's still ready to rumble with the big boys. This car has been maintained by its current owner for over 38 years, and comes with tons of receipts and documentation, including the original gas tank build sticker showing its original build date and ordering dealer. Third generation Corvettes are increasing in value rapidly and chrome bumper big block cars demand a premium. The chrome bumper, big block 'Vette comes with both tops and is ready to show and is reliable enough to be driven daily. This 1968 Chevrolet Convertible for sale is located in our Houston showroom. See more of it, including HD pictures and a video of it at http://gatewayclassiccars.com/houston/1968/chevrolet/corvette-S646.html. For more information on this 1968 Chevrolet Corvette please contact the Houston Showroom at 832-243-6220 or email us at houston@gatewayclassiccars.com.

title: 1968 Chevrolet Corvette

description: The 1968 Chevrolet Corvette was a year of inspiring design with a new body and new interior, based upon the Mako Shark show car. Mechanics were improved, the 2 speed automatic transmission was replaced with a new 3-speed. A new sales record was set with 28,566 models sold for that year.This Corvette convertible has had a complete frame off restoration. Only 600 miles have been driven since it was completed.The exterior is Rally Red with a white convertible top. Paint is excellent with no visible flaws and all chrome and trim is in top notch condition.Interior is the red bucket seat leather console interior. All components present in show condition.Engine is the 429/390 hp paired with the automatic transmission. Engine, transmission, and rear end are all matching numbers. This Corvette has power steering. Mechanics are top notch as this restorer has spent a lifetime driving, building, and restoring old cars and is quite an expert.You can view this 1968 Corvette convertible by appointment. Car is located in South Carolina.
title: 1968 Chevrolet Corvette

description: Ground up restored, 2 top roadster. #s match motor, trans, rear and colors. Has it's vin #s matching HT code 350 hp motor with upgrades. Vin # matched 4-speed and correctly dated and coded 3.70 rear. We will gladly put this car on the lift to show the underneath. Has clean, painted chassis and clean original fiberglass floors. Just about every component has been replaced. Front and rear suspension is rebuilt, replaced brakes, brake cables, shocks, springs, stater, exhaust, BFG tires etc. Motor compartment is cleaned, painted and has several new components. Upgraded performance with aluminium intake, Holley carb, Mallory distributor and headers. Should be a good 400 hp now. The body and paint are slick. Has a smooth glossy finish. Jambs and hardtop repainted too. The chrome is bright. New wheel trim. Windshield, weatherstrips and window seals are new. Interior is restored including door panels, carpet and upholstery. Has upgraded CD stereo with custom speakers and amplifier. Black convertible is in nice shape. Collector grade quality, #s match investment grade and fun factor gets a high grade!

title: 1968 Chevrolet Corvette

description: There's not much better in the world then being behind the wheel of a big block 'Vette. But a complete restoration to everything from the bold red paint to the 420+ hp 427 V8 makes this 1968 Chevrolet Corvette a true dream machine that's available today at a gone-tomorrow price.

Red Corvettes are so iconic that they write songs about them.  And this car truly knows how to inspire a tune.  That's because there has been an investment in the 1968-correct Rally Red to give this classic color a modern shine.  That means sunlight rolls off the shark-like nose and tall fenders so evenly that you can't help but attract attention.  Even the details received all the right attention â€“ the doors shut with confidence; the big block hood has the proper 427 callouts; the body gaps that appear quite even; and the headlight door fit flush. Trim and chrome look good, including the optional luggage rack, and it pairs up well with the clean, 15-inch rally wheels. So the total package is certainly a Stingray that will stand out from the crowd.

Inside, the correct saddle tan interior looks great against the red paint.  You can instantly tell by the condition of the bucket seats, door panels, carpeting, and dash that there has been a nice investment in keeping this looking its best.  Corvettes have always been a great personal sports car by providing a nice mix of performance features and plenty of creature comforts, and this one does it right.  You get a three-spoke steering wheel that gives you a commanding view of the large dual pod gauges for the speedo and tach.  Just to the side are a full set of auxiliary readouts for all your vital info.  Plus, accessories like the AM/FM stereo and clock were rebuilt to look correct while still being useful.  But we know your favorite part of this coupe will be lowering the power windows, taking out the T-tops, and removing the rear window so you can hear the big block road while enjoying the backroads.

Tilt the hood forward to reveal year-correct 427 cubic inch V8.  This big block was part of the full restoration, and so it's ready to be shown off with the polished valve covers, distributor shield, and the air grabber that boldly proclaims its power superiority.  And when you look beyond the shine, you will see the substance of a rebuilt V8 that has been upgraded and fortified.  This includes a bored .30 kit, a rebuilt JET Performance four-barrel carburetor, and a host of new parts, including timing chain, gaskets, camshaft, lifters, pistons, and so much more.  But Corvette fans should take note, because this Stingray was highly original before restoration, many of the original components come with the sale, too.  This creates that perfect balance where you get a big V8 that fires-up easily and delivers reliable performance (dynoed at 423hp!) and at the same time, you get to continue its factory history.  So it's a classic you can enjoy.  And this is only heightened by great anytime driving f

title: 1968 Chevrolet Corvette

description: 1968 Yellow Corvette 4spd Convertible

Numbers matching, 36,900 original miles, 327/300Hp motor, 4 speed manual transmission, black interior, rally wheels,  power steering, factory side pipes, AM/FM/Cassette, wooden steering wheel, black convertible top, and much more.

We changed the oil and filter, rear end grease and additive, and checked and lubed the chassis. We replaced the master cylinder, 4 calipers, 4 brake hoses, 4 sets of brake pads, fuel tank, fuel pump, rebuilt carburetor, spark plugs, cap and rotor, spark plug wires, points and condenser, starter, alternator, sway bar links, and much more.
This corvette runs and drives strong with a great sound from the side pipes.
This is a real Red-Red Corvette.  The previous owners redid it in Pittsburgh Steelers colors years ago.

1968 was the first year for the C3 body style, and also brought about a new interior design and removable T-tops. GM also introduced the pop-up headlights and pop-up wiper door in this year. 1968 was the highest production year for the Stingray convertible with 18,630  released out of 28,566 total production.
For more information, pictures, and videos: http://www.hobbycarcorvettes.net/corvette/1968-red-corvette-convertible-stingray-for-sale/
title: 1968 Chevrolet Corvette

description: Rare 1968 Corvette Convertible - Matching # 327-350 HP & Factory Air Conditioning, 4 speed manual & Power Steering
Imagine the looks and smiles generated by this totally new body style in the fall of 1967.
It gets even more today !  There was nothing else on the road like the 1968 Corvette.
This example begs to be driven.  Very responsive with the optional 350 Horsepower 327 and smooth-shifting 4 speed manual.  Runs cool with no signs of overheating.  Easy to handle with Power Steering.
Includes the factory intake and Rochester carburetor.  An aftermarket intake and carb are currently installed.  Has the factory high performance Double Hump heads.

Run this Convertible through the gears and relive the memories of warm summer nights and burbling exhausts.  Rides smoother than most early Corvettes, as it has an advanced, Composite rear spring for improved handling and comfort.  Also has high performance, adjustable rear strut rods, so you can fine tune the rear suspension.
Throttle response is instant due to the 11.0 to 1 compression ration.
Factory instruments and lights function properly.  Headlamps raise and lower by vacuum as designed.
Folding top is in good condition with clear rear window.
Correct, one-year-only door opening handles and buttons operate just as Larry Shinoda designed them to do when he first drew the Mako Shark II that became the 1968 Corvette.
Exterior trim is in good condition.  Chrome bumpers are correct and shiny.
This is a rare factory Air Conditioning equipped, High Performance 327-350 & 4 speed Convertible.
This is your opportunity to own a relatively scarce Corvette Convertible that you can drive and enjoy while it appreciates.  Restore it now or later, it's a great investment.
Call or e-mail us before this great Corvette goes into someone else's collection.
Schultheis Garage & Classics, LLC
410 W. Fayette Ave.
Effingham, IL 62401
www.sgccars.com

title: 1968 Chevrolet Corvette

description: How many opportunities will you have to acquire a truly special big block C3 Corvette?  This particular coupe checks many boxes for the discerning collector.      The subject of a highly detailed and documented rotisserie restoration, this numbers matching Corvette came equipped with a 427/390 hp engine, 4-barrel carburetor, Turbo Hydra-Matic transmission, power steering, power brakes and posi-traction rear end.  And its finished in the correct LeMans Blue acrylic lacquer...just as it left the factory.    Got your attention?      Bloomington Gold certification, combined with documentation and ownership history going back over 30 years, makes this highly optioned Corvette a special candidate for any Corvette collector.  The frame off restoration is meticulously documented and photographed, showing virtually every nut and bolt, every important serial or part number, all organized and catalogued in great detail.      This beautiful Corvette reflects the time, effort and considerable cost invested in its restoration.  It comes with the original owners manual and AM/FM radio instruction booklet, still in original plastic, wheel trim ring instruction sheet and 1968 Corvette color brochure, all in excellent condition.      No issues, no excuses.  Even down to the correct bias ply redline tires.  If you're serious about documented authenticity, this is the Corvette for you.  To find out more, call Art & Speed at (901) 850-0507.

title: 1968 Chevrolet Corvette

description: Number matchingwith Turbo Hydra-Matic automatic transmission, power steering, and power brakes! Great color of one-year only offered British Green over Tan interior! Rare, first year t-top coupe possessing RPO L36 big block 427ci V8 producing 390 horsepower! Act quickly! Modeled after the Mako Shark show car, the new C3 generation of Corvette was introduced in 1968 with entirely new bodylines! Although not officially re-titled the Stingray yet, the C3 generation lasted a lengthy 15 production years with only minor changes to the exterior styling. Today, they are among the most sought after, and affordable classic Corvettes on the market today! Finished in very desirable British Green (983) over Saddle interior (420), this numbers matching 1968 Corvette Coupe comes loaded with options! Starting with its original L36 427ci V8 producing 390 horsepower, you get a rare first year M40 3-speed Turbo-Hydra-Matic transmission, power steering, power brakes, 3.08:1 Heavy-Duty Posi-Traction rear axle ratio, original Delco AM/FM push-button radio, 15 wheels with bright metal wheel covers, red stripe Yokohoma radial tires, removable T-top roof panels & rear window, faux wood steering wheel, carpeted floor mats, and original Soft-Ray Astro-Ventilation side glass! The major component numbers are below: Engine cast number: 3916321 HI-PERF (1968 early cast number) Engine cast date: L 28 7 (Dec 28th, 1967) Engine VIN stamp: 18S412269 Engine date stamp: T0214 IQ (Feb 14th, 1968- 427ci/390hp with automatic) Transmission stamping: 1101203 (non-original) Rear end date code: 1AW 2 8 68 W (3.08:1, Feb 8th, 1968) Nearly 28,600 vehicles were produced for this new generation Corvette, but only 9,936 were built in the T-top coupe form making them a little more difficult to find, especially with favorable options and original equipment! This particular example is showing 47,529 miles that may be original, but we do not have enough evidence to support a true mileage claim. The frame remains wonderfully rust free, smooth, and solid. The exterior paint and interior seat upholstery were refinished previously and continue to show well with only minor visible wear or small flaws. All of the electrical and vacuum systems are functional including most of the interior fiber optics, all interior courtesy lamps, headlight operation, factory radio, dash lights, wipers, horn, etc. The brake calipers have been replaced for stainless steel versions, new brake master cylinder & booster, and new shocks can be found at all four corners. A more modern Vette Brake Products(VBP) fiberglass rear monospring was installed. A new battery was installed in May 2017. It will come complete with T-top storage bags, owners manual, original jack, wrench, and spare tire. It runs terrific without any disappointments! Please feel free to call with additional questions or to schedule an opportunity to view the car in person. Thanks for looking!
title: 1968 Chevrolet Corvette
